description: From Middle English faitour, from Anglo-Norman faitour (cognate with Old French faitor (“doer, maker”), from Latin factor, factōrem, from facere (“do, make”).

entries.meaning: (archaic) A charlatan or imposter, especially one pretending to be ill, or to tell fortunes.
examples: Quick, now, little faitour. What do you want to know about Gondal?
